so i created a basic project to try to pin down the issue with sharedelementtransitions
<https://github.com/lawloretienne/SharedElementTransition>

My issue is that when you click on an item that is partially obscured by the navigationbar or statusbar, then either bar will just flicker during the shared element transition.  I tried a couple different “fixes” but nothing has worked.  Any ideas??
never noticed that issue :thinking_face:
cool! yeah. im testing the entire user interaction too but i dont think hitting the api is the right way to go. so, i prefer to mock the response so, better way to handle expected error.

<@U055GGAHS>: so you've worked with both Realm and Requery. What is your opinion? Requery looks pretty nice to be honest. A problem with Realm is the fact that you need to keep track of a Realm object and need to begin and commit transactions for certain stuff.
requery’s docs are so so bad
<@U04TK850N>: tell me
well, I tried to use a many-to-many relation. Couldn’t get it to work
Ya same for DBFlow
I was happy to see it supported that automatically, but it was impossible for me to get it to work
Couldn't get that working nicely either and I ended up creating an intermediary table myself
and all you can do is check their sample app and tests
So went back to ORMLite and implemented the relation table for the n-to-m relation myself
Alright, I'll keep it to Realm then
I like Realm mostly but I think if you do really complex stuff you might miss some flexibility
Ya, I don't really use it for complex stuff.
I basically need it for caching stuff.
<@U061HDV96>: requery docs are lacking but his unit tests cover basically everything you need.
I'll keep it to Realm for now I guess.
I have no run into anything that did not work
if you have a problem, he is super responsive on the issues as well
